title: Winning Moves Games Monopoly The Mega Edition
description:
Product Description

The same classic board we all know and love PLUS 9 new properties including 7 new states! In Monopoly the Mega Edition, you'll be able to build skyscrapers AND the game will play faster thanks to the Speed Die - invented by Winning Moves! Winning Moves Games was founded in 1995, and is a leading producer of iconic board games, card games and handheld puzzles. With a talented group of designers, developers and marketers, our mission is to provide happiness to consumers by offering classic, retro, cool and fun games for play with friends and family. Monopoly The MEGA Edition is recommended for everyone ages 8 and up, for 2 to 8 players.

From the Manufacturer

Everyone loves the timeless game-play of Monopoly. Now, with Monopoly: The Mega Edition, you'll be able to own more properties, build more buildings, handle more cash, and -amazingly- play faster than ever before!

reviews.name: American Consumer
reviews.reviewTitle: we are hardcore Monopoly players and this has become our new favorite edition. It brings a new spin to the ...
reviews.review: We were a little hesitant to get yet another edition of Monopoly. We have about a dozen different editions already. My three boys and I are addicted to Monopoly. In any case, we are hardcore Monopoly players and this has become our new favorite edition. It brings a new spin to the game by adding another level of buildings (skyscrapers and train depots), more money ($1000 notes, e.g.), and of course more properties (every set has one additional property - except the railroads). If you are not interested in playing forever, use the speed die which will help ensure that the game ends sooner rather than later once there are some developed monopolies on the board. Most of the game is well thought-out. There are a few exceptions, however. For example, there is a chance card that says to move to the next utility and roll the dice and pay the owner 10 times the number rolled. Well, if you own all three utilities, the rent is 20 times the number rolled. It seems like in fairness, the owner of three properties should get 20 times. We do not like that bus tokens can expire. I see the point...but it's rather annoying. We're debating whether or not to remove the cards that force all other cards to expire. We also think that the bus tokens should be reused - like Chance and Community Chest. Despite these anomalies, the game plays well and super fun. If you're already a Monopoly addict, then this will be a lot of fun. If you've never played, you might want to start with regular Monopoly and then work your way up to this edition later.

reviews.name: Adam Leonard
reviews.reviewTitle: Great for fans of the original
reviews.review:
I randomly stumbled upon this game one day, and being a huge fan of Monopoly as well as similar types of games, it immediately clicked with me. I heard this from some online forums claiming that with Monopoly being a terrible game, Mega Edition fixes seemingly every problem people may have with it. Of course, I ignored that first part, I was really just interested in trying out this game, the bigger board, and its new mechanics. And I was not disappointed in the slightest.

I was able to gather together a group of 7 people, including myself, to test this out. Immediately it was apparent that the bigger would be better to support larger groups of players. The original game features 28 purchasable spaces, and this version has 36. It makes for more balanced games, giving everyone more property to work with, more money to deal with, and it becomes harder for a player to actually get a monopoly. In that sense, yes, it becomes a lot easier to get into. And I can back that up as a good 3 of the people I had been playing with, who originally hated the game, are now a lot more open to playing as long as we use this board. I was personally satisfied as this was a great expansion upon the original that did not fundamentally change how to play the game. Basically in the end, everyone was satisfied with this version of the game.

Of other reviews of this game that I have seen, people seem to be complaining about two things - the time it takes to set up, and 'customization' because (apparently?) you can customize the board. I do not care at all for customizing the board, so if that scares you, just ignore it. I'm not even sure what they are referring to, but any kind of board customization is completely unnecessary. As for the set up time, it just takes as long as regular monopoly, and if you know how to do that efficiently, it takes 5 minutes.

Overall, there is nothing I particularly find bad about this version of Monopoly. Everything is either an improvement or easy to overlook. Worst case scenario - just apply house rules so you can play how you want. I love, and I hope more fans of Monopoly get to experience this version.

reviews.name: Stickman
reviews.reviewTitle: So far loving it. Introducing the game to a new generation.
reviews.review:
What can you say about Monopoly? It's probably the best board game in the world. This one is very big. Really big. About 2' square on the board. And it has more than houses and hotels, it has skyscrapers. And there are 3 piles of cards now. And BEST YET: The tokens are metal and nicely made. You get a money bag, top hat, race car, horse, wheelbarrow, thimble, cannon, scotty (dog), shoe and ship. The bank tray is also nice.

My only suggestions: Needs more money if you are going to play with the max no. of players and the deeds really should be a little thicker material and laminated. That's what I did with our old game. They have a coating but it's still just a thin card. Note like the original. Also the money sticks together. That will probably change with wear.

But over all a great new version of Monopoly. :-)

reviews.review: I grew up playing monopoly but never played the game at it's true length. This board is amazing it's big enough to play as a group of 6 comfortably and the added rules such as bus tickets make room for serious strategy. This is amazing if you're staying home for a while with friends and family and just looking to have a low effort good time. Highly recommended!

The new stuff is fun but at times annoying it‚Äôs actually fun to play the original monopoly rules without adding in the new stuff. Overall it‚Äôs a fun game for die hard monopoly fans and for monopoly fans who want a change.

reviews.review: an interesting variation of the classic game. the speed die is a fun idea but takes away from skill and traditional probability. the big novelty is that it is a bigger busier game with more properties and many more rules which are not always clear or well explained. a painful learning experience for those used to serious classic monopoly play. if you like the classic game you will enjoy playing mega monopoly.

no puedo decir nada malo del juego, es magnifico, me encanto y si lo combinas con mecanicas de otros monopoly o piezas, es simplemente un juegazo !!

title: MONOPOLY Animal Crossing New Horizons Edition Board Game for Kids Ages 8 and Up, Fun Game to Play for 2-4 Players
description: In this Monopoly board game, players can enjoy island life and immerse themselves in the colorful and creative world of Animal Crossing New Horizons. Moving around the board with tokens inspired by the video game, players complete island tasks and meet other characters. Instead of buying properties and paying rent, players collect bugs, fish, fossils, and fruit. They can also stop at Nook's Cranny and cash in Bells to buy decorations. Decorations are worth Nook Miles and the player with the most Nook Miles wins the game. Monopoly: Animal Crossing New Horizons board game is for ages 8 and up and makes a fun indoor activity for kids.

reviews.name: Keyeno
reviews.review:
Boy that was quick, hoping to get a copy for genuine purposes...
For those that don't want scammed, the current MSRP is $24.99.

reviews.name: Joshua R. Tompkins
reviews.reviewTitle: Fun game but not true to the source material.
reviews.review:
I recently picked up a copy of this game because my wife, kids and I are all fans of Animal Crossing. That being said, there are so many inaccuracies and missed opportunities it's sad.

Starting with the basics, the 4 corners were kept in the classic Monopoly theme. Go could have been Town Hall, Go to Jail could have been Booker and Copper, and Free Parking could have been Able Sisters.

The value of the money was broken down to 1 coin or 5 bell bags. The values should have been 100 for the coins and 1000 for the bags of bells. With the bags being worth 5, you run out of money far too quickly.

The four skill bonuses for passing Go the first time are off balance with some being clearly better than others. Not only that but at least one of them is very unclear.

Many chance cards are just plain disappointing to get as they make you lose money.

Store cards are based on items you would craft and instead should be based upon items you would actually purchase from Nooks. Their values should be better balanced as well to line up with the actual game.

Nook miles cards were in short supply and ran out quite quickly.

Having a cap of 7 items you can buy limits any strategy for passing up low point items and maximizing your point totals.

On that topic, not capping the amount of Islands you can claim can put some players at a disadvantage. Max number of tokens should be adjusted based upon number of players. Additionally, the static island system is flawed as you can only get to islands in New Horizons via Dodo airlines, and they destroy the flight plan after each trip so you can never actually return to the same island twice.

I feel like this was either not playtested whatsoever, or maybe not tested by anyone who was familiar with the source material, and as an item marketed to fans of the game, this does a poor job representing not just Animal Crossing, but Spinoff Monopoly games as well. If Monopoly can't get the themeing down right for this, how can I be sure they'd get it right for other franchises like Fortnite, Dragon Ball or others?

reviews.name: Bonnie R. Peck
reviews.reviewTitle: WAAYY over priced for the market value.
reviews.review: The game is super fun but definitely shop around first. I just found this at Walmart for less than half the price and mad at myself for spending $60 when I could have spent $25.

reviews.name: Jordan
reviews.review: Monopoly Animal Crossing New Horizons is wonderful for kids and adults. Shipped fast and wrapped for a safe delivery. Yes, price was more than other sellers but item came in two days. Other sites offer pre- orders for August.

reviews.name: Tiffany
reviews.review: It is a cute game. As an Animal Crossing and Monopoly fan I just had to get it. I am disappointed in the quality of the product. The dice are smaller than normal. The unique die has stickers that have to be put on yourself and they are not the best sticky stickers and hard to center just right as they are sized too close to the size of the die. I didn't get my stickers on perfectly straight and the edges of the sticker hang off. Speaking of stickers, the box is closed by 4 big circle stickers that stick too good. I tried to peel them off as it seemed it would peel off, but alas, no, it ripped the box artwork. If they were stuck to the box neatly I would have just cut them open with a knife and left the plastic sticker on the box, but they were wrinkled and goofy in position, leaving clear plastic hanging. The cardboard parts inside the box are thin. It just has a feel of a cheap game. Not the same quality as a typical Hasbro brand product or Monopoly brand game. Even the printout of the instructions are poorly printed with dark background and blurry ink that makes reading difficult. For the price point I expected higher quality. It is still very cute and the saving grace is its Animal Crossings. We own other recent Monopoly spin offs and find they are fun to play but a big difference in strategy compared to the original layout. We haven't played this one yet as I'm saving it for gift giving. I just wanted to check that we had all the parts in our box since others have commented about missing pieces. And since I was so disappointed in the quality I thought others may want to know. I wish I could have gotten mine without the 4 clear circle stickers holding it close as they have made my box ripped up ugly. It worth shopping around to see if another store will have it shrink wrapped instead.

reviews.name: ren
reviews.review: This game was a gift for my kids. It is easy to learn and can be played in a decent amount of time. The set up takes a little time the first time as you have a lot of prices to punch out of the cards initially. I enjoyed the game as well and we have played quite a few times since they received it in December. My kids are 10 and 13 and both enjoyed it but I‚Äôm sure younger kids would be able to pick it up pretty quick and as an adult I enjoyed it more than original monopoly! Definitely recommend!

reviews.name: itzme
reviews.review: This is easily one of our family‚Äôs favorites. It really feels like you‚Äôre playing Animal Crossing, without the screen time! Game play feels familiar if you‚Äôve played ACNH, and it‚Äôs easy enough for kids to learn while still being fun for adults. The duration of the game is much more manageable than most every other version of Monopoly out there. It needs to come with more Bells, though - we run out too quickly! Buy the game, you won‚Äôt regret it.

reviews.name: David Mansfield
reviews.review: My wife and all three of my kids are obsessed with Animal Crossing. So, when my wife saw this, the had to have it. It is of the quality that you would expect in a Monopoly game and adds a new turn for fun. I am not into Animal Crossing but the Monopoly take on it was a fun family pastime. A must have for Animal Cross fanatics and fun for the rest of us too.
